abstract.p: Gateway will temporarily absorb the sales tax for consumers who buy desktop and notebook PC's at most of its 290 Country Store locations (S)

block.p: Hoping to take the no-tax edge away from pure direct-sales rivals like Dell, Gateway will temporarily absorb the sales tax for consumers who buy desktop and notebook PC's at most of its 290 Country Store locations. The promotion, which began yesterday and ends tomorrow, was started after Gateway executives saw sales spike when states like Pennsylvania and South Carolina offered sales-tax blackout periods to their residents. ''The response to that program was huge, so we decided to extend it to additional states,'' said Brad Williams, a company spokesman.
